intro: Bidens amphicarpa, commonly known as the two-seeded tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has distinctive yellow flowers with dark centers and produces two small, round seeds in each flower head. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Bidens amphicarpa is also known for its ability to spread rapidly and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
